questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Windows Control Panel?
options: Modify and control hardware and software settings
questions.explanation: Control Panel is used to make modifications and control tasks for almost every aspect of the hardware and software including OS functions.

questions.question: What information does Device Manager provide?
options: List of all devices and their status
questions.explanation: Device Manager provides a list of all the devices installed in the computer and their statuses, making it a useful troubleshooting tool.

questions.question: What is the purpose of User Account Control (UAC)?
options: Monitor programs and alert on system-threatening actions
questions.explanation: UAC monitors programs and issues alerts when applications attempt to make changes that could threaten system security.

questions.question: Which tool allows management of multiple aspects of local and remote computers?
questions.explanation: Computer Management allows for the management of many aspects of the computer and remote computers in one comprehensive tool.

questions.question: What command opens System Configuration utility?
questions.explanation: The msconfig command opens System Configuration, used to identify problems preventing Windows from starting correctly.

questions.question: Where can you configure all network operations in Windows?
questions.explanation: Network and Sharing Center allows administrators to configure and review nearly all network operations in a Windows computer.

questions.question: What does Event Viewer log?
questions.explanation: Event Viewer logs the history of application, security, and system events, which are crucial for troubleshooting.

questions.question: Which tool manages Windows services?
questions.explanation: The Services console (services.msc) allows management of all services on local and remote computers.

questions.question: What does Windows Firewall do?
options: Prevents malicious attacks by controlling network traffic
questions.explanation: Windows Firewall prevents malicious attacks by permitting and denying traffic to and from the PC based on security rules.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Credential Manager?
options: Manage passwords for websites and Windows applications
questions.explanation: Credential Manager helps manage passwords that are used for websites and Windows applications in a secure location.

questions.question: What does Performance Monitor display?
options: Real-time info about processors, disks, memory, and network use
questions.explanation: Performance Monitor displays real-time information about processor usage, disk activity, memory consumption, and network utilization.

questions.question: What is Action Center in Windows 7/8?
options: Centralized location for security and maintenance alerts
questions.explanation: Action Center is a centralized location showing alerts divided into security and maintenance sections.

questions.question: Which Administrative Tool schedules automated tasks?
questions.explanation: Task Scheduler allows you to schedule programs and scripts to run automatically at specific times or events.

questions.question: What tabs are available in Internet Options?
options: General, Security, Privacy, Content, Connections, Programs, Advanced
questions.explanation: Internet Options contains tabs for General, Security, Privacy, Content, Connections, Programs, and Advanced settings.

questions.question: What permission level allows full control including changing permissions?
questions.explanation: Full Control permission allows all actions including reading, writing, deleting, and changing permissions on files and folders.

questions.question: Which tool shows shared folders on the system?
questions.explanation: The Shared Folders snap-in in Computer Management shows all shared folders, sessions, and open files.

questions.question: What is the default UAC setting in Windows?
options: Notify only when programs try to make changes
questions.explanation: The default UAC setting notifies users only when programs try to make changes to the computer.

questions.question: Which account type has unlimited access to the system?
questions.explanation: Administrator accounts have unlimited access to the system and can make any changes to the computer.

questions.question: What Windows feature helps parents control children's computer usage?
questions.explanation: Parental Controls (Family Safety) allows parents to set time limits, control access to games and programs, and monitor activity.

questions.question: Where are local user accounts stored in Windows?
questions.explanation: Local user accounts are stored in the Security Accounts Manager (SAM) database on the local computer.

questions.question: Which Windows component manages automatic updates?
questions.explanation: Windows Update manages the download and installation of updates, patches, and service packs from Microsoft.

questions.question: What is the purpose of System Restore?
options: Restore system files to a previous state
questions.explanation: System Restore creates restore points that allow reverting system files and settings to a previous state without affecting personal files.

questions.question: Which network location type has the highest security settings?
questions.explanation: Public network location has the highest security settings with network discovery and file sharing disabled by default.

questions.question: What PowerShell command lists all services?
questions.explanation: Get-Service is the PowerShell cmdlet that lists all services on the system with their current status.

questions.question: Which folder contains user profiles in Windows?
questions.explanation: C:\Users contains all user profiles in modern Windows versions (Vista and later).

questions.question: What Windows feature encrypts individual files and folders?
questions.explanation: EFS (Encrypting File System) encrypts individual files and folders on NTFS drives, while BitLocker encrypts entire drives.

questions.question: Which tool manages disk partitions in Windows?
questions.explanation: Disk Management (diskmgmt.msc) is the built-in Windows tool for creating, deleting, and managing disk partitions.

questions.question: What is the maximum password length in Windows?
questions.explanation: Windows supports passwords up to 127 characters in length for maximum security.

questions.question: Which service must be running for file and printer sharing?
questions.explanation: The Server service must be running to share files and printers on a Windows computer.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Windows Mobility Center?
questions.explanation: Windows Mobility Center provides quick access to laptop-specific settings like brightness, volume, battery, and presentation mode.

questions.question: Which policy editor is available in Professional editions?
questions.explanation: Local Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc) is available in Professional, Enterprise, and Education editions for advanced system configuration.

questions.question: What happens to a user's files when their account is deleted?
questions.explanation: Windows prompts whether to keep or delete the user's files when deleting a user account.

questions.question: Which Windows feature provides single sign-on in corporate networks?
questions.explanation: Domain membership provides single sign-on capabilities and centralized management in corporate networks.

questions.question: What tool monitors real-time system resource usage?
questions.explanation: Resource Monitor provides real-time monitoring of CPU, memory, disk, and network usage with detailed process information.

questions.question: Which Windows component manages driver updates?
questions.explanation: Device Manager allows manual driver updates while Windows Update can automatically download and install driver updates.
